ygData.subject: RE: Some praise and a few questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, I m a few posts behind you. :-) I did do this without safe fall, but you re right, it can be painful (hence throwing in the Hymn). However, there is a
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, I'm a few posts behind you. :-)

I did do this without safe fall, but you're right, it can be painful (hence
throwing in the Hymn). However, there is a side of the island which doesn't
slope as severely. I usually ran across this area and turned "up" a steep
area, then ran across and came "down" a flatter area.

Every now and then I would try a Chains, but it it fails, you're toast.

---Windleaf


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Peck White [mailto:peck_white@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 11:10 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Some praise and a few questions
>
>
> From: Peck White <peck_white@...>
>
> Replying to my own message I was level 22 at the time.
> I read the post about kiting them when you get low on
> hp. As rough as the terrain is I can't imagine
> surviving this tactic without Safe Fall.
>
> Tomerrilin
>
> --- Peck White <peck_white@...> wrote:
> > I tried soloing a gargoyle Wednesday night. I was
> > using a Silvery War Axe primary and a Dragoon Dirk
> > secondary. I was induced to take a dirt nap. It was
> > close though. I think if I had've gotten some lucky
> > rolls on the melee I would've won. At level 20, I
> > don't think you would stand a chance.
> >
> > Tomerrilin
> > Mith Marr
> >
> > --- TommyC <uber_sorcerer@...> wrote:
> > > 2. My other toon is a mage(20th Level) and he
> > is
> > > now in OOT soloing gargoyles. Can I do the same
> > with
> > > my bard or will the gargoyles rip me a new one?
